fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Service Desk does not offer the possibility to know which projects an organization belongs to.

h3. Suggested Solution

When accessing the organization itself, there should be an option to all the projects that make use of that organization.
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk admins to see all projects linked to an organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a ticket is moved or transition from an approval-configured status to a non-approval status, the agent view (in Jira) still shows options for approving the ticket (Approve and Decline). 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

h5. Scenario 1 (Moving the ticket from a workflow with approval to a non-approval workflow)
# Modify the workflow from an issue type on a Service Desk Project to require approval, and have at least one issue type on the same project that does not have approval as part of the workflow.
# Create a ticket on the issue type that needs approval
# Move the ticket to the issue type that does not require approval

h5. Scenario 2 (Transition a ticket from approval status without setting approval)
# Create a workflow with approval and create a transition to back from the approval status to the previous status. Publish the workflow.
# Create an issue and transition to the approval status. Transition it back to the previous status. The 'Approve' and 'Decline' buttons will keep available in the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results
Approval is no longer needed for the ticket

h3. Actual Results
The ability to approve (or decline) the ticket is still shown in the User Interface. Please note that clicking on the 'Approve' or 'Decline' button will not change the status of the ticket.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround

h3. Notes
This bug report is a combination of two previously reported bug reports, [JSDCLOUD-4444|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4444] and [JSDCLOUD-5039|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5039]. 

*Do note that a similar issue for Jira Service Desk (Server) has already been fixed in version 3.3.0 as stated in [JSDSERVER-4630|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4630] and [JSDSERVER-4444|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4444].*
fields.summary: Approval option shown after issue moved/transition to a non-approval status

fields.description:
Currently we have a Login Portal App which able to jump into JIRA Service Desk. 
However we want use their credential that are saved in our portal to login into JIRA Service Desk. 


*Problem*
We have created a custom plugin which used REST API to handle creating new user in our portal and automatically create a user in JIRA Software. But the problem is, we are not able to set users password for JIRA. I know that JIRA handled all about user's password, but is there anything else that you can suggest for us? 
We don't want to let the user interact with JIRA Authentication (Setting Their Password, Login by Username and Password).
We just want them to be able login to JIRA using their credentials that are in our portal. 

Thank you
fields.summary: Automatically Login into Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Transitions in  {{Service Request Fulfilment workflow for Jira Service Desk}} in the customer portal are not translated or renamed to any language or other keywords if they changed  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the default workflow {{Service Request Fulfilment workflow for Jira Service Desk}} and change *Escalate* to *Priority* for example  
# Change the language of the customer portal to any other language eg. German.

h3. Expected Results
The transition name *Priority* are translated to German.

h3. Actual Results
The transition name is still showing the old keyword *Escalate*
The transition name are not even translated.

h3. Notes
Other transitions such as Respond to Support is translated to Support antworten.

h3.Workaround
No workarounds.
fields.summary: Portal transitions are not translated or renamed when editing the default generated workflow

fields.description:

If there is an exception in processing incoming email (for example, attachment is too big) JSD put it into the description during issue creation

h2. Expected result
Issue is created. Error message is placed into the description

h2. Actual result
Issue is created. Non informal error message is placed into the description

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
# Create a user at JIRA;
# Create a new SD Project;
# Edit this username in a way to add his email address. For example:
old username: john
new username: john@isntance.atlassian.net
# Assign the SD user role to this new user.
# Create a ticket and assign it to this new user.
# On Workload of SD Project, click on the "Issues in progress" to see the issues of this new user.

Current behaviour
The issue count is showing the correct number of issues, but the JQL won't bring any results.

Expected behaviour
The issue count is showing the correct number of issues, and JQL should return this user's issue.
fields.summary: JQL of workload Report doesn't brings results if users have changed the username

fields.description:
h3. Summary

CSAT report does not show information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Answer the satisfaction survey after a ticket is closed, it's not clear what triggers the double information on the database yet.

h3. Expected Results

Only one satisfaction information should be logged on the database.

h3. Actual Results

Somehow two entries were found for satisfaction and satisfaction dates custom fields in the database with a difference of two milliseconds related to the same issue, which got the satisfaction report stuck.
 
e.g.
DVS-1070,Satisfaction date,2017-10-10T19:19:07.915Z,2017-10-10T19:19:07.940866Z,2017-10-10T19:19:07.940866Z
DVS-1070,Satisfaction date,2017-10-10T19:19:07.931Z,2017-10-10T19:19:07.956909Z,2017-10-10T19:19:07.956909Z

h3. Notes
It happened twice with the same user when answering the satisfaction survey.
When running the JQL behind the satisfaction report and the defective issue is on the list, the error 500 returns.
When running without ORDER BY Satisfaction date DESC the error does not appear.

h3. Workaround

Contact support.
fields.summary: CSAT report does not show information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, time to resolve report doesn't track issue time spent weekly/monthly until the issue is resolved. On top of that, it doesn't provide the information for each of the issues. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a report to track issue time spent weekly/monthly until the issue is resolved. 

h3. Why this is important
Easier for admin to track issue time spent for resolved issue by weekly/monthly

h3. Workaround 
Use third party plugin, for example:-
# [All-In-One Reports for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.kaanha.reports/cloud/overview]
# [Tempo Timesheets for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/is.origo.jira.tempo-plugin/cloud/overview]
fields.summary: Ability to create resolved issue report with time spent information

fields.description:
Currently, according to this article [How to Change the Sender's Name of the Service Desk Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-sender-s-name-of-the-service-desk-notifications-933708029.html] sender's name for JSD notifications can be changed. But it only works as long as issue is un-assigned. Once assigned, it shows the name of assignee in notifications.

There should be a way to permanently change the sender's name in notifications.
fields.summary: Admin should be allowed to change the Sender's Name of the Service Desk Notifications

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Custom fields that are updated through an automation rule on Service Desk by the issue created trigger are having their values reverted to the default value set for the custom field when a request is created through email with participants on Cc, this only happens when ScriptRunner add-on is installed and active on the Cloud site.

h4. Environment

JIRA Service Desk Application 3.3.0-OD-1000.2313.0
Adaptavist ScriptRunner for JIRA Cloud 1.1.17-AC

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Have ScriptRunner add-on installed and active (No need to start the trial)
# Create a custom field and set a default value for it
# Associate with a Jira Service Desk project screen
# Set an automation to trigger on issue creation to change the value of the custom field to any other than the default
# Send an email to the Service Desk with other customer(s) on Cc to be added as a request participant

h5. Expected behaviour

Issue is created with the request participant(s), updated by the automation to change the custom field value.

h5. Actual result

Issue is created with the request participant(s), updated by the automation to change the custom field value, but in the same action that the participants are added, the custom field value returns to the default value.

h4. Workaround

Add an additional trigger to the automation for *Participant added to issue*, this will make the rule run again and maintain the desired value.

_This workaround will not cause any side effects, it will simply make sure your automation rule run again when request participants are added._

h4. Notes

- The same behaviour will happen with all custom fields changed by an automation on similar configuration.
- The behaviour will happen even if the default value is _None_
- The issue is not present if ScriptRunner is disabled.
- This issue has also been reproduced in the same conditions as above when adding request participants directly through the portal after ticket is created.
fields.summary: Custom fields changed by automation rule are reverting to default value on issue creation through email with participants

fields.description:
h5. 1 - Specify and understand:

_Description of the problem:_

Rest API calls using the requestOwnership=ORGANIZATION parameter is not returning the results

 

_Steps to reproduce (actual vs expected behavior):_

# Crete a SD Project

# Create an Organization within this project with a few customers

# Create a few tickets within the SD project on behalf of some of the Organization members

# Use the following API to return those tickets -+{color:#59afe1}https://\{Instance_name}.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request?serviceDeskId=\{SD_ID}&requestOwnership=ORGANIZATION&organizationId=\{Org_ID}{color}+


*Expected behavior:* All issues belonging to members of the Organization should be returned


*Actual behavior:* No ticket is returned

h5. 2 - Workaround:
Use the API call: +{color:#59afe1}https://\{Instance_name}.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request?serviceDeskId=\{SD_ID}&requestOwnership=ALL_REQUESTS{color}+
fields.summary: JIRA REST API - The requestOwnership=ORGANIZATION parameter is not returning results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If participant doesn't have permission to see the KB article then application behaves non informal - either show error or redirect to the portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce

_Prerequisites:_
 * You have an existing service desk project with the linked KB space and article which is visible to some number of users
* Request has reporter who can see the article and participant who cannot
* Request has KB link the the comment

 # As participant go to the Customer Portal and click to the KB link

h3. Expected Results

Link is not clickable or there is a message that you dont have permission to see it

h3. Actual Results

* If participant open link in another window he see following error: "There was a problem contacting the application"
* If participant click to the link he is redirected to the Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If "Assign issue" permission is not provided to Portal Customers, they will be unable to share request with other customers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Grant User's Permission to share request to anyone.
# Go to the permission scheme and remove the "Assign Issue Permission" from "Service desk customer - portal access" role
# Logged as a Portal Customer, create a request and try to share it.


h3. Expected Results

Once you enter the email address of the person you want to share the request with, you hit "Add" and the participant should be included on the ticket.

h3. Actual Results

Hitting "Add" will not include the other user as a participant.

h3.Workaround
JIRA Service Desk will detect this permission inconsistency and will show a pop-up window, suggesting the resolution of the issue.
fields.summary: Customers are unable to share request if "Assign issue" permission is not provided

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The documentation [Set up customer permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/set-up-customer-permissions-732528940.html] needs to be improved to explain that when the "Who can access the portal and send requests to My first service desk?" setting is set to "Anyone can send a request without logging in", customers still need to login to view their request (although they don't need to login to create a request).

This setting can be mis-leading since it is about "Who can access the portal", so it could be interpreted as "Users can access the portal to view their request".

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful to add a line in the column "Anyone can send a request without logging in" in the section "Who can send requests?" that customers will still need to login to view the request their submitted.
fields.summary: Clarify the documentation about the setting "Who can access the portal and send requests to My first service desk?"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the email visibility is set to hidden or masked, the request from Widget fails to create issue to JIRA. Help seeker still see a "thank you" confirmation message because requests are created asynchronously.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On *System > General Configurations*, set *User email visibility* to "Hidden"
 # Set up the widget
 # Add the widget to a webpage
 # Create a request with the widget

h3. Expected Results

Request is created in Jira
h3. Actual Results

Help seeker see a "thank you" confirmation message, but the request is never created in Jira
h3. Workaround

Set the email visibility to "Public" or "Show to logged in user only":
 # Go to *System > General Configurations*
 # *Edit* the configurations
 # Change *User email visibility* to "Public" or "Show to logged in user only"
fields.summary: Request from Widget is Not Working when Email Visibility is Set to Hidden or Masked

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user previously deleted in Jira, sends an email to a public Service Desk project. Tickets are not generated by those emails, and those users are not added to the project. They also cannot sign up for an account or raise a ticket via the portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete a user from Jira
# That user sends an email to a public Service Desk project

h3. Expected Results

Ticket is created and user is added to the project as a customer

h3. Actual Results

Ticket and customer are not created or set as active

h3.Workaround

- Manually add those users to the Service Desk project via the Customers section. 
- Any user deleted after the [username changes in JSD|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2018/04/portal-only-customers-have-a-randomly-generated-username] should no longer be encountering this issue.
fields.summary: Emails sent by externally deleted users do not create new tickets even though the project is set as 'public'

fields.description:
Jira Service Desk has the option to send out an invitation email to new customers with a link to the customer portal. This email can be enabled or disabled by using a checkbox but cannot be customised.

Jira Service Desk also has an email verification step for portals where anonymous portal isn't enabled. This email cannot be currently customised.
fields.summary: Customise the portal invitation email and verification email sent to new customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, 'Create Linked Issue' screen only shows the system default fields and required fields as per field configurations. See JSDCLOUD-3917. 
When a field is set to required via *Workflow Validator*, the field will not be showing on 'Create Linked Issue' screen and blocking the creation of issue.
h3. Customer Impact

Cannot create linked issues via 'Create Linked Issue' screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Workflow*, set a field to mandatory on *Create* transition (i.e Assignee)
 ## On Workflow, switch to *Diagram* mode
 ## Click on *Create* transition
 ## Choose *Validator*
 ## Add validator > Field Required Validator > Add 'Assignee' field
 ## *Publish draft*
 # Go to any issue
 # Click on *...* > Create linked issue
 # Choose the project and issue type that associate to the Workflow on Step 1
 # *Create*

h3. Expected Results

Issue is created.
h3. Actual Results

Issue cannot be created as that's not possible to provide value for the required field.
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

If it is not a system locked field, set it to Required on Field Configurations so the field can show on 'Create Linked Issue' screen.
 * Note that changes on Field Configurations will affect the projects that share the same configurations

If it's a system locked field, you have to create the issue via 'Create Issue' screen
 # *+* > *Issues*
 # Link the issue to the original issue
fields.summary: Unable to Create Linked Issue Due to Workflow Validator

fields.description:
Cannot see the issue view for issues that show up in the custom report drilldown.

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Go to a custom report that contains a series with issue counts (e.g. issues created, issues resolved)
2. Click on a data point on the report or from the summary (to get to the drilldown).
3. Click on the issue key or issue summary

h3. Expected Result
We show the issue view in the report context

h3. Actual Result
We get taken back to the report summary

h3. Workaround
Click the issue key / issue view in a new tab. 

h3. Other symptoms
* The url of the custom reports are wrong, this means that you can't bookmark them and hitting refresh will take you back to the workload report. The workaround is to just clicking the report again.
* The user cannot delete reports in Jira new experience look and feel. The workaround for this is to disable it and then delete the report.

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Service desk report gadget is available in JIRA Cloud but not in Server. After migrating to Server, all Dashboards with the Service desk report gadget will not be accessible in Server with error 500 on the UI.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# In a JIRA Cloud instance, create a new dashboard with the Service desk report gadget.
# Generate a backup for server and restore it to a Server instance.
# Upon successful restoration, log in and browse the dashboard created in Step 1.

h3. Expected result
The dashboard can be viewed properly with the Service desk report gadget not available due to [this limitation|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-222].

h3. Actual result
The dashboard will display a 500 error page with error below in the stack trace.
{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
{code}

h3. Workaround
Remove the Service desk report gadgets from all dashboards before generating a backup for Server migration
OR
Fix it from the database side
(i) Always back up your data before performing any modifications to the database. If possible, test any alter, insert, update, or delete SQL commands on a staging server first.
# Execute the SQL query below to identify all dashboards with the Service desk report gadget.
{code:SQL}
select * from portletconfiguration where (dashboard_module_complete_key like '%servicedesk%' OR dashboard_module_complete_key like '%buble%');
{code}
# To remove the gadgets from these dashboards, execute the SQL query below.
{code:SQL}
delete from portletconfiguration where (dashboard_module_complete_key like '%servicedesk%' OR dashboard_module_complete_key like '%buble%');
{code}
# Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Dashboard is not accessible after migrating from Cloud to Server throwing "String index out of range: -1"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an existing customer raises a request through the customer portal without being logged in (login-free portal), JIRA does not associate the email from the field "Email confirmation to" with the existing Customer, causing to no associate the Organization that the customer is from. 

h3. Suggested Solution
If the individual email address has an existing user, associate it correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Enable email requests
# Configure a custom email address. JIRA already has a template for Google accounts.
# Send a few test emails

h3. Expected Results

- Emails will be processed and issues will be created according to your customer permissions. 
- All email activity will be registered on the [Processing Log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-jira-service-desk-incoming-mail-790960076.html]

The issue seems to be intermittent and eventually, JIRA will start processing messages again. However, emails received during the outage will be skipped by JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When multiple attachments are uploaded with the same name, whilst each individual image is saved to Jira itself, in the customer portal the customer see's duplicate attachments of the first image uploaded - after saving that is, the preview shows as intended. Also in the comments on the Jira side the same attachment repeats itself like in the portal. But if you go to the attachment field of the issue you can see the individual images. 

Presumably, because it looks for the image name, finds the first image with that name and re-uses the same image for each subsequent attachment. This is very confusing for customers who believe they uploaded the same image multiple times. This also makes it very difficult for the agent to know which attachments belong to which comment.

You notice this a lot when customers have to paste multiple screenshots into a ticket.

 ---------------------------------------------------------

I have attached two images (one is 6&nbspkB, the other is 14 kB) to this job with the same name: {{Image001.png}}.

Only the last loaded image will display for multiple references to the image.
 !Image001.png!

The list of attachments seems to understand that the two are different as one of them is greyed out. When you click on the greyed image name, the correct image is displayed.

The situation that precipitated this suggestion is from a ticket I worked where the reporter supplied three images, but only the last one was displayed. 
 !sameImage.png|thumbnail!

Clicking on the middle one of the attached images list showed a different image.
 !imageX3.png|thumbnail!

When you click on one image and then scroll through the pictures, the different image is displayed.

 

[added] Noted that when you have the THUMBNAIL view of the attachments, you can see the different image (and its name is normal rather than a link color). The above problem is more obvious when you have the LIST view of the attachments,
fields.summary: Improve handling of images with same name.

h2.Summary

The opt out from notification link in JIRA Service Desk notification has no confirmation step. This causes certain mail scanners to trigger the link directly causing the user to get opt out of notifications when the mail scanner scans the link to see if it's safe. Having a confirmation step upon clicking the link in the email will prevent such things from happening.
fields.summary: Provide confirmation step when clicking on the notification opt out email

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the support email address is included in the distribution list, when someone replies to the email address, the mail handler assumes that the reply is actually a request to create an issue, this then ends up in the queue of the project with summary: "RE:" for each reply from the people within the distribution list. This is of course an expected behavior but it would be better if the mail handler had a better ability of machine learning to differentiate between replies and actual issue creation. 
h3. Expected Results

For the mail handler to be able to filter and not create issues when users in a distribution list reply to a distribution list including the support email address of the service desk. 
h3. Actual Results

Each time the users in the distribution lsit reply to the ticket they were cc'ed, the JIRA notification mail handler processes those replies as new issues which are then created into the Service Desk Project. Each time the users reply to the cc'ed email, JIRA notification isn't able to detect any issue key linked to those replies therefore JIRA assumes it's a new issue email creation and thus proceeds to create a new issue in the instance.
h3. Workaround

# Make sure those users are only replying to the notification of the ticket created via email address which leads to the jira notification mail handler and not the email that they are cc'ed into. 
# Make sure the users do not reply to each other via the cc'ed email, this will create a long thread of replies which will be continuously created as new issues into the instance. If the user wants to comment on the issue, all of them will have to only reply to the ticket created by email as that is the only email with a issue-key which then directs all the comments and reply to one issue only instead of creating multiple issues.
fields.summary: Ability to Allow Support Email Address To Be Included in Distribution List

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
If a User whether it is an agent or customer sending an email with an existing issue key on its subject (or have an intention to comment on an existing ticket), if they don't have the permission to view the ticket due to security level, this misleading "You do not have permission to view this attachment" will shown on the JSD Email Settings "Processing Log"

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Dummy Service Desk project and set the Mail Channel
# Create a new Issue Security Scheme and set the Security Level as simple as:
## Name: Level 1
## Reporter
## Current Assignee
## agent1
# Assign the scheme to the dummy project.
# As a customer create a ticket
# Back as an agent1, set the security level of that ticket to "Level 1"
# As an agent2 that have the permission to access the project, prepare an email with the issue key as the subject.
# Comment on the mail body and attach a file.
# Send the Email

h3. Expected Result:
* The email will be rejected as the agent2 does not have permission to access the ticket with a message "You do not have permission to view the ticket" on the "Processing Log"

h3. Actual Result:
* The email is rejected with a message "You do not have permission to view this attachment" on the Processing log

h3. Notes:
* Based on my test:
** If there is no attachment, the comment is added even though that user not able to view it.
** If there is an attachment, with the "You do not have permission to view this attachment" the attachment is still added while the comment is not.
fields.summary: You do not have permission to view this attachment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The user wants to ensure the email generated from Atlassian system are clean in design and does not contain any Atlassian system default footnote at the bottom, the user considers this as advertisement placement in normal day-to-day email response.
h3. Sample Picture

!atlassian.png|width=823,height=84!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to turn off/remove or edit the default footnote design generated by the Atlassian email system.
h3. Why this is important

The user wants full control of the email template that is being generated by the Atlassian system, to a certain extent, user has the ability to edit the footnote content which is auto-generated as well, this allows user to be more in control of the service that is being used, in this case the notification settings.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Only Service Desk Agents are able to reply directly to a customer.  So when a Jira Core or Jira Software users posts an internal comment to a JSD ticket, the customer on the end has no idea this has happened.   In some cases it would be useful to at least have the system send an email notification that the issue has been updated, even if it cannot display the full content of that message


h3. Suggested Solution
All JSD customer notification options to allow the system to notify customers that an internal comment has been added.


h3. Why this is important
It could be seen as a way to communicate with the customer that "we are working on this"

h3. Work-around
It could be possible to use the automation rules in order to send a notification to the customer of an event like this.
fields.summary: Service desk customer notifications should provide the configuration option to notify customers when an internal comment is posted to an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When some of the customers reply to a JIRA Service Desk ticket via email, the reply is updated in the ticket with an attachment, the attachment has randomized characters (e.g 0U7RJajw, 4xyjPWbM, GD4pwvBa). Opening these attachments, it actually is a compressed file which includes the customer's reply and the record of previous conversation of the ticket which are quoted. These attachments are usually less than a few kbs in size.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the mail handler to have the ability to filter/remove the compressed attachments by default.
h3. Why this is important

With the removal/filter of these unwanted attachment, the attachment view of the issue is much clearer and relevant to the issue. This also decreases the load of attachment overall in the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to Remove/Filter Compressed Attachment in JIRA Service Desk Each Time Customer Replies

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update from Product team (9th December 2021)}
Hey all,

We are excited to announce that this feature has now been rollout out to all users.

You can learn more [here.|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management-articles/Doing-JSM-Customer-Notifications-Right/ba-p/1877664?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=kudos_article&utm_content=topic]

We would love to hear your feedback.

Cheers,

Ben
{panel}
Emails from JSD that was sent out using domain other than atlassian.net is rejected by DMARC.

Both SPF and DKIM checks are performed against the atlassian.net domain. So as far as DMARC is concerned no relevant validation has taken place for the domain and therefore got rejected.

*Update :* Upon further investigation it looks like DMARC is not compatible with the custom email address setting in Jira Cloud. DMARC explicitly check that the domain in the From: header matches those that pass in the DKIM-Signature: header.

This is further corroborated by this [FAQ entry|https://dmarc.org/wiki/FAQ#Why_are_messages_I_send_on_behalf_of_visitors_to_my_website_being_blocked.3F] on the dmarc.org website. At this time there is no option to control the Reply-To: header in Jira Cloud. This option need to be added to in the Jira product and is raised with this feature request.

The following workaround is suggested for affected instance with this limitation.

*Workaround* :
 # *Whitelist IP* range from this [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html]
 # Use From: address the default *<user>@<instance>.atlassian.net* email address
fields.summary: JSD Notification were not sent out due to failed DMARC/Marked as SPAM. Add option to control the Reply-To: header in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
Our organization cannot use JIRA Service Desk because of the following:

 

It is an unreasonable expectation for our customers to create an account in our application AND a JIRA account if they need to submit a support ticket.

 

JIRA Service Desk allows anonymous access to our Service Desk portal for viewing documentation and submitting support tickets.

 

After creating an anonymous ticket, an email is sent to the email address provided when submitting the ticket. In that email, there is a link to view the ticket that was submitted in JIRA to see updated status and comments and respond with comments when necessary.

 

This link, however, requires the user to register/login in JIRA in order to view the submitted ticket. (Which is unreasonable per above)

 

Desired behavior:

The email sent to the user should contain a link that allows the user (or anyone with the link) to properly view and comment on the ticket (and no other tickets) without having to register/login.

 

This link is essentially security though obscurity (and would need to have high entropy), but is an acceptable tradeoff to avoid having to register/login given the information that would be in our support tickets. For those organizations where that is not an acceptable tradeoff, requiring their customers to register/login would be desired.

 

Other Comments:

Allowing the Group "Anyone" browsing access is not supported in JIRA Service Desk. This is for good reason, as any anonymous user would be able to browse other users' support tickets.
fields.summary: View an issue the user submitted from an email link without having to register/login to JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
Summary

When a customer logs in to the customer portal, the user is able to see the customer portal options but if the user clicks on the logo or the help center link above the Customer Portal name, the user is redirected to the help center which does not display the links to redirect back to the customer portal under *Popular or Browse All.* 

Steps to Reproduce
 !missing02.png|width=679,height=324!
 # Customer log-in into the customer portal > Click on *Help Center* link above the Customer Portal title(e,g Atlassian Test Service Desk) or Click on the *Logo* 
 !missing01.png|width=551,height=269!
 # The customer is brought to the general help center page where there is no link to click on back to the customer portal that the user initially arrived to.

Expected Results

!missing03.png|width=788,height=283!

The customer is brought to the general help center page where user is supposed to be able to search for other customer portals or click back on the customer portal link to redirect back to the customer portal page. The *Popular* and *Browse All* option should be available.

Actual Results

The customer is unable to see any links to redirect back to the customer portal in the Help Center page.

 

Workaround:

There are four workarounds to redirect back to the customer portal:
 # When you reach the *Help Center* page by clicking on the logo or the Help Center link in the customer portal page, simply refresh the page and it will automatically redirect you back to the customer portal page
 # Log out from the Help Center and login back and it will bring you back to the customer portal
 # In the Help Center page, start searching for some queries and a list of the customer portal will appear.
 # *BEST*: Create an issue in the project via raising request and once the issue is created, the links will appear back as normal in the Help Center page. _Please note that, creating an issue within the queue of the project setting will not count it has to be done via raising request from a customer portal point of view._

 

Important Notes:

In order to replicate this issue, from the Administrator point of view:
* The project setting needs to ensure that the only people who can access the portal is *Customers my team adds to the project* in the Customer Permission setting.
* The project also cannot contain any issues within the project to replicate this situation. If an issue is created, delete it and ensure the queue is empty.
fields.summary: Help Center Does Not Show Link To Available Customer Portal

fields.description:
When sending an email to [user@example.com|mailto:user@example.com] and adding the JSD email handler in bcc (e.g. issues@example.com) the ticket is created correctly but the user is added as a request participant. This kind off exposes the bcc.

 

I would not add request participants when the jsd-email-handler is in bcc.
fields.summary: Do not add participants when JSD email is in BCC

fields.description:
Currently, the permission needed to allow customers to choose their own approvers, is to make them able to search "Any customer or organization" as below:

"If customers will choose approvers before you begin, make sure your Customer permissions > Who can customers share request with? setting is on Any customer or organization, by searching in this project. This ensures that customers can search for approvers."

However, this exposes all customers in any organization which is not desired result for many customers.

Suggestion is to add an option to search only in the same organization as the customer.
fields.summary: Allowing customers to choose approvers only in their organisation

fields.description:
Summary

When using Internet Explorer 11 and accessing the *Customers* tab in a project setting, the user is unable to click the *Add Customers* or *Add Organizations* button, when clicking an arrow appears at the bottom of the button but there is no pop-up which allows the user to add the required users.

Environment
 * Internet Explorer 11

 

Steps to Reproduce

!add_organization.png|width=906,height=116!

!add_customers.png|width=884,height=131!
 # Open a Service Desk Project > Click on the *Customers* tab > Click on *Add Organizations* or *Add Customers* button, the button will be unresponsive, an arrow will point at the clicked button and not open the pop-up to create the users

Expected Results

The user should be able to click on the Add Organizations and Add Customers button

Actual Results

The user is unable to click on the Add Organizations and Add Customers button

 

Workaround

Use a different browser such as 
 * Google Chrome
 * Firefox
 * Safari
fields.summary: Unable to click on Add Customers and Add Organizations Button in Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Due to a recent change, when exporting issues via CSV, the Customer Organization field is exported with the Organization ID and no longer brings the name of the Organization name. While this format is better for further JIRA imports, it is not human readable and may cause some confusion.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk Project.
 # Create a Customer Organization under the project. Ex: Atlassian
 # Raise a ticket on behalf of a member of the Atlassian Organization.
 # Go to the Issue Navigator and export the issue to CSV (All Fields).

h3. Actual Results

The column "Custom Field (Organizations)" displays the organization ID instead
h3. Desired Results

The column "Custom Field (Organizations)" will display "Atlassian" on the Issue Row.
h3. Workaround
You can find the Org ID by hovering your mouse over the Org and then referring to the URL, the ID will be the last digit. Or just click on the Org and check the address bar for the last digit. eg: https://completelyrandom123.atlassian.net/projects/ISD/organization/3  <- 3 is the organization ID.
You can then use this to find and replace in your spreadsheet.

Or Contact support
fields.summary: Export CSV - Ability to export Customer Organizations with their respective name instead of ID

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When a customer visits the customer portal, the customized Help center name in the breadcrumb is not displayed and instead the default text *"Help Center"* is shown if their profile is using a language that is not configured as a supported language of the service desk.
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service desk with only one configured language, e.g. the default language *US* being used.
 # Change the Help Center name setting on the customer portal.
 # Change your profile language to something other than the service desk default, like English (UK). 
Visit the the customer portal > Click on Customer Profile icon > choose *Profile* > Edit preferences > Change your language to something other than the service desk default, like English (UK).


 # Visit any page containing a help center breadcrumb, e.g. the profile page, the single portal, etc.
 # Notice that the Help center title breadcrumb is incorrect, the user will see the text *"Help Center"* instead of the configured help center name, despite the help center name displaying correctly in the header bar.

!helpcenter_04.png|width=972,height=180!

h4. Expected Results

The customer should still be able to see the customized help center name.
h4. Actual Results

The customer should be able to see the customized help center name.
h4. Workaround

The only way the customers will be able to see the customized help center name is if they change they're profile language setting to *Automatically detect browser setting* or if the language setting matches the default language set in the project configuration.
h4. Documentation:

[Translating your customer portal and supporting languages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/translating-your-customer-portal-and-supporting-multiple-languages-886180551.html] 

{color:#172b4d}Customers can set their preferred language in their profile. If they don't, your portal detects the language set in your customer's browser. It will try to display this language first. {color}

{color:#172b4d}If you don't support their preferred language, the portal displays the project's default language. We recommend setting the default language to match the native language of the majority of your customers.{color}

Customers see the project default language if:
 * you haven't added their preferred or detected language

 * their preferred or detected language is disabled

 * they only interact with email support and haven't set a language preference
fields.summary: Customer Portal Header Title Does Not Display The Customized Help Center Name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unsaved comments are cleared in a JIRA Service Desk issue (Agent View) when editing any field under the People Section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JIRA Service Desk issue (https://cloudinstance.atlassian.net/browse/AA-11
# Click on *Click to add Comment* and input a text in the comment box. Do not save
# Click on any field under *People* section (Assignee, Reporter, Request Participant)
# Add a user on that field

h3. Expected Results

The People field should be saved and the Agent should be able to continue with the unsaved text in the comment box.

h3. Actual Results

The People field is saved and the comment section is cleared.
fields.summary: Unsaved comments are cleared when editing a People field

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

In JIRA service desk, it is possible for a user to belong to multiple organizations.

Can a functionality be added so that when a customer creates an issue from the customer portal, they are required to select an organization the issue is to be shared with rather than doing this after the issue has been created?

h5. Use Case Scenario

# If a customer is a member of multiple organizations. If he decides to raise an issue and the issue is meant to alert only members of a specific group, there is no way to ensure the customer selects an organization when they create the issue or even after the issue has been created.
# If a customer portal is accessible to multiple users within multiple client organizations, how will the admin be able to identify which company /organization the user is from when he requests assistance? Sometimes the user may not signup from an email with the company domain (he/she might use his personal one) and trying to find out the company name from their email id is not a very sophisticated approach.

h5. Suggestion

Add a functionality that allows the project admin to force the selection of the organization field when it is required for the project in question.
fields.summary: Make Organization Field Required for certain projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary



{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
We have implemented a new function mypendingApproval() which solves this. The definition of mypending() has been changed.

Please refer to https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-search-reference-jql-functions/

{panel}

When using the JQL Approvals = myPending, it shows tickets that are already approved by current user.
 The ticket only disappears from the list if all approvers approved the request.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the workflow for Approval request type, on the approval step - set "Consider approved after - All approvals"
 # Create a ticket that approval is needed for more than one approval.
 # One user approves the ticket.
 # Search for Approvals = myPending() (when logged as user) or Approvals = pendingBy(user.name).

h3. Expected Results

The results show only what is pending for the user who is searching Approvals = myPending(), even though it's necessary approval from another user.
h3. Actual Results

The results show the tickets that are already approved by the current user because the another user hasn't approved yet.
h3. Notes

It was reproducible on another instance.
 This issue also happens on the Customer Portal > Requests > Approvals
fields.summary: Filter Approvals = myPending() shows what is already approved when pending other approvers

fields.description:
Summary

When a customer tries to search for a custom query within the *Request* option of the customer portal of an instance, the results shown per page changes as you move from one page to another without any consistency. If there is no query entered in the search bar, the results displayed are correct and as you navigate from one page result to the next there is no issue, the issue per page count is correct. This is only apparent when a custom query is entered within the search functionality of the *Requests* portion of the customer portal. In some cases, it displays that there are a total of 4 pages of issue count to navigate but if you click on Page 2 of Page 4 all of a sudden it decreases to 3 pages only instead maintaining the initially seen 4 pages to navigate.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any customer portal access page > Click on the top corner *Requests* > Choose *All Requests*/ *Organization*/*My Request (as long as the issue count displayed per page is more than 1 page)
 # In the search field (Request contains...) > search any query that will produce a result with more than 1 page of content.
 # The results will be filtered based on the custom query > Scroll down and note the page number and the issue count per page
!Page_1.png|width=489,height=638!

 - Example: Page 1 (1-20 of 27)

 # Click on the Page 2 and notice the change in the issue count and the page number
!Page_2.png|width=691,height=424!

 - Example: Page 2 (21-27 of 7) , the page navigation can disappear as well depending on the total issue count that is filtered from the query

Expected Results

To be able to navigate through the pages and view the filtered issue based on the custom query properly.

Actual Results

Filtered issue based on custom query changes from page to page without consistency and is hard to actually check and navigate through the issues in a proper manner.
fields.summary: Pagination Shows Wrong Value When Search Box has Query Entered

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is not possible to add a new request participant if an inactive user exist in the request participant list

h3. Customer Impact
* User unable to add new request participant

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to People > Request Participant
# Add a request participant to a list of already existing participant that include at least 1 existing inactive user
# Click confirm button
# An error appear  "Cannot add user <User Name> because they are not a customer on this service desk"

h3. Expected Results
New user is added as a request participant

h3. Actual Results
An error appear  "Cannot add user <User Name> because they are not a customer on this service desk"

h3.Workaround
Remove inactive user and add the new user as a request participant.

Note : Inactive user is prevented from being added as it is part of Jira business logic. This is expected. When adding a new user, the existing values in the field are being treated as a new input and will do a check on all values instead of just the new value. There is some need to retain the old users for historical and for when the user need to be reactivated.
fields.summary: Not being able to add new request participant if an inactive user exist in the request participant list

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when setting an automation based on SLAs, it's only possible to "Run as project default".

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to "Run as the user who triggered the rule" or just a JIRA notification.
fields.summary: Ability to change the notification on automations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Due to the recent change in JIRA Service Desk customer portal update, the header is now made pure white with the logo positioned to the top left of the header and the customer login and request details to the top right of the header. With this recent change, previous customer branding is now affected as additional customization has to be done to reflect the logo properly.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow user to edit and colorize the header of the customer portal like before the customer portal update was applied.
h3. Sample Picture

Header is plain white following the background of the entire page instead of being a section of update of it's own.

!header_01.png|width=834,height=200!
h3. Why this is important

With the ability customize the header, user has better control over the look and feel of the support center. User is also able to promote their branding style and recognition to their customer.

 

Documentation:
[New Help Center Update|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/08/check-out-the-new-help-center]

{quote}All help centers and portals will switch to the new design on September 1, so make sure you customize yours before then.
{quote}
 
{quote}Note that the topmost white header isn't customizable, so if you have a white logo you'll have to upload a darker one for it to be visible.
{quote}
fields.summary: Ability to allow User to Edit the Customer Portal Header Look and Feel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The user is unable to remove or edit the visibility of Help Center Link above the Support Center Name, user also feels it's redundant as the logo link and title link both redirect to the same location.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow user customization options to remove or edit the visibility of the Help Center link. 
 - 
h3. Sample Picture:

Mouse is hovering over the *Help Center* link.

!help_center.png|width=490,height=224!
h3. Why this is important

With the ability customize the link, user has better control over the look and feel of the support center.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the Help Center link from portal pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When open a JIRA Service Desk ticket in JIRA, users are currently not able to sort the request types dropdown list alphabetically. It would be great to have this feature available in Service Desk, so that if a customer has a long list of request types, users can easily choose the right request types.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to sort the request types from the dropdown list on view issue page
fields.summary: To allow users to sort dropdown list of request types alphabetically in the view issue page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a request with approval is canceled/closed and was not approved or declined, it will leave the approval pending.
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Version: 1000.2047.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request with approval
# Set the user to yourself
# Cancel the request

h3. Expected Results
Approval removed from the request.
h3. Actual Results
Approval left pending

h3.Workaround
Remove the approval from the approval field.

h3. Notes
The same behaviour observed when Closing issue without approving.
fields.summary: Canceling a request with approval leaves the approval pending

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there are no article restrictions for different organizations
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow restrictions to knowledge base articles based on organization
h3. Why this is important
 It is crucial for some organization to have information that they would not want to leak to competitor organization
h3. Workaround 
Separate organizations into different projects. Link projects to separate knowledge base space.
fields.summary: Allow restrictions to knowledge base articles based on organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For a Service Desk Project, when creating a report, the user is able to create multiple series which covers a range of organization and customers. Though, this process can be rather cumbersome as with a large amount of organization, there will be bigger data to capture. The user requests for an option within the report creation screen to include multiple organization within one series and at the same time separate the outcome of the user within each organization for a tally of results. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the *Service Desk* project
 # Click on the Report tab > Click on *New Report* > Click on *Add Series*
 # There is no options to create data within multiple organizations. 

h3. Use Case

There are 3 organization and there are three customers from each of this organization.
h3. Report Displayed 

Tickets Raised in Last Month By Customer
Organization A                           Organization A                          Organization C 
Customer A - 27 tickets 
                                              Customer B - 32 tickets
                                                                                             Customer C - 7 tickets
h3. Expected Results

To be able to list multiple customers within one series separated by their respective organization in the list. Instead of just listing the date each of the tickets has been created,close, etc. 
h3. Actual Results

Only able to see the date and day of the created,close,etc , the label is used as an identifier to plot on who the customer is. For instance, the label can be named: organization_a|customer_d
h3. Workaround

The workaround currently is only the ability to create one series per customer and per organization which can lead up to a very lengthy list of series.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit the Customer and Organizations Which is Displayed in the Report Graph and Results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The feature "custom logo for this Customer Portal" allows uploading images of great sizes but they are severely reduced. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Grant proportional sizes to the images or ability to choose a larger area of the image.
fields.summary: Proportional size for custom logo on Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk customer unable to view all requests that have been raised by other customers in the same organization if the request has an issue security level configured.

However they _can_ still access such issues if they access it via a direct link (only if Issue Security level is given to Service Desk Customer - Portal Only Access).

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Issue security level which includes Administrator role and "Service Desk Portal - Customer Access"
 # Set the security level in an issue
 # Invite a new user as a service desk customer
 # Assign the service desk customer as a participant of the issue
 # As the customer, go to the Service Desk portal and select Requests -> All requests

h3. Expected Results

Issue should be visible to the customer

 

h3. Actual Results

_Issue is not visible, however can be accessed with direct navigation (if customer has a direct link)_
fields.summary: Users unable to see issues with security level configured in Service Desk Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The SLA can only be configured by project admins and cannot be set on individual tickets
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow agents to define SLA on individual tickets
h3. Why this is important
Reason is that organization has issues which may have random response and resolution times
fields.summary: Allow agents to define SLA on individual tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you add the option "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" to an *Issue Security Level*, it is not allowing service desk Customer to view issues.

 
h3. Environment
h3. v3.3.0-OD-1000.2047.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Service Desk project, add a default security issue level to all your newly created issues
 # Add the Field Security Level to your Service Desk Screens and to the request types to properly configure the security level to all issues created on the customer portal
 # Add the option "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" to the default Issue Security level
 # As a customer, create a new issue and navigate to *All requests*

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to see his own request.
h3. Actual Results

The number of requests is properly displayed on the customer portal, however, the user is not able to see his own request or get notifications about any updates on his ticket.

h3. Notes
# The same issue occur when using "Reporter" and possibly other JIRA fields
# If a request has Issue security with option "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access", automation with the option "User who triggered the rule" will also not run. Using *Service Desk Customers* allows the automation to run.


h3. Workaround

Add the Customer users in a different way to the *issue security level*. e.g: project role *Service Desk Customers*.
fields.summary: The option "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" is not working on Issue Security

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the new look and feel for the Help Center the color for banner background, link and buttons is the same. 
Reference: https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/08/check-out-the-new-help-center

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to choose separately the background settings as well as for links and button colors.
fields.summary: Ability to choose separately the colors on Help Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Atlassian blogged about new feature called "Login-free Portal"  but when customers started to use it, on the issue view for Service Desk request Channel it called "Anonymous Portal" which is misleading
https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/introducing-the-login-free-portal

 !anonymous.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Make your Portal login-free
# Create a request
# See Service Desk request Channel

h3. Expected results
"Login-free Portal" wording is in use

h3. Actual results

Service Desk request Channel named as "Anonymous Portal"
fields.summary: Login-free access called "Anonymous Portal" for the Service Desk request Channel

fields.description: Service Desk admins should be able to email cSAT reports on a schedule automatically.
fields.summary: Customer Satisfaction reports to be emailed on Schedule

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Page property report macro displays an error when viewed as an unlicensed customer account and through the Customer Portal.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Version: 1000.2002.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Knowledge Base confluence space to Service Desk project
 # In the linked space create 2 pages: 'Page A' and 'Report'
 # Add Page Properties Macro on the Page A, add table inside the macro with some data, for example: 
|Deadline|09 Sep 2017 |
|Current Status|Done|
|Team|Green Parrots|

 # Add label 'test' to the Page A
 # Edit Report page and add Page Properties Report Macro, in the macro settings search for 'test' label, Results for Page A should come up, update the page.
 # Go to Customer portal and search for the Report page

h3. Expected Results

Macro displays result in the page
h3. Actual Results

Macro displays
{code:java}
Error while fetching page properties report data:{code}
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro displays an error when viewed through customer portal
/rest/servicedeskapi/request endpoint returns error 500 instead of the correct error message for null values

fields.description:

_avatarId=null_

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Request Type icon displays as broken image when in View Issue Screen

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JSD Version: 1000.2002.0 (Cloud)
